result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation on case 21CF1731.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Huber with Standard Release Conditions. Sentence credit of 35 days was granted, TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Attorney Kees advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

02:15 PM Defendant Jason L Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kees states they will waive preliminary hearing today. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and goes over waiver of right to preliminary hearing on the record. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. State files information. Defense accepts information and waives reading. Defense enters not guilty pleas. 

Court conducts plea colloquy. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court finds Defendant guilty to Count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Attorney Kees makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes a statement to the Court.

Court orders the following:
35 days in the Waukesha County Jail with Huber (all standard release conditions).
35 days credit.
TIME SERVED

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation in connection to Case Number 21CF1731)
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation in connection to Case Number 21CF1731)
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
